intro: Toulicia guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese toulicia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its habitat in tropical regions, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate.
